text:
Would it be possible to create the blog template modularly? Instead of placing the content only in the post body, I want to build the whole post with many modules (like: text, single image, content slider, gallery, CTA, text box, …) just like the pages.

I know that I can add the modules code by embedding code to the post body, but the modules only appear after a reload and as soon as you want to edit the post body, the module view disappears and the modules code becomes visible again.

Is there a better way to load the modules into the editor? In the sidebar on the left side of the pages there is the “+” symbol to add modules, but this is missing in the blog.

I'm interested in a reply to what <@UEC4WRSFK> has said (<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CDSFETF5X/p1547642000124900>)! And welcome <@UFGHCS538>.

Is anybody familiar with deep links and Branch?  I'm concerned that using a branch link will strip UTM parameters as referenced here.  Will a Branch link be basically the same as using a <http://hubs.ly|hubs.ly> or <http://bit.ly|bit.ly> in this context?

Hey guys! I have a user who is looking for help with blog comments if anyone has any thoughts, tips or tricks to share with this user, I would super appreciate it!! <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Blog-post-comments-not-saved/m-p/245499>

Thanks everyone :slightly_smiling_face:
